txt.en: 'I have steeled myself for a sad parting, but your presence here should help. I am ready if you are, my friend.'
Talk to Ravaedron and help him say good-bye to his friends
Talk to Ravaedron outside Fernbrake Cot
'Then let there be an end to my delays! \qSooner done, sooner past,\q as they say. It is not an Elven expression, of that I am certain.'
Ravaedron has requested you accompany him to bid farewell to the last friends he made in Middle-earth, before he departs for the West.

'I... do not understand, [placeholder]. I expected my farewell to contain a measure of sorrow for all of us, of course, but I did not think to quarrel. I do not want to leave it like this! But what can I do?'

Ravaedron frowns at the closed door of Fernbrake Cot.

'I am dissatisfied, [placeholder]. How can my friends wish for me to depart in this fashion? Did I not make clear to them that they will be protected by such adventurers as you even when I am gone? I am certain I did. I meant no insult.'
Ravaedron stands outside Fernbrake Cot, steeling himself for a sad parting.
Ravaedron stands outside Fernbrake Cot, confused and unsatisfied.
